name: ProShares Short Russell2000
description: ProShares Short Russell2000 (SRTY) is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that seeks to provide inverse exposure to the performance of the Russell 2000 Index, which is made up of small-cap U.S. stocks. Launched in 2013, SRTY allows investors to take a bearish position on small-cap equities, meaning that it is designed to increase in value when the Russell 2000 index declines. This fund is particularly appealing to traders looking to hedge their portfolios against downturns in the small-cap sector or to speculate on market declines. The management of the fund uses various financial instruments, including derivatives, to achieve its investment objective of providing -1x the daily performance of the Russell 2000 Index. SRTY is part of the growing trend of leveraged and inverse ETFs that have gained popularity among active traders seeking to capitalize on market volatility. The fund is structured to provide daily results, making it a suitable option for short-term trading strategies rather than long-term investments. Investors should be aware of the risks involved with inverse ETFs, including potential losses and the effects of compounding returns over time. As a product of ProShares, a leading provider of alternative ETFs, SRTY offers a transparent and efficient way to gain exposure to market movements, making it a tool for sophisticated investors aiming to manage risk and enhance returns.
